across.text: Place to drink in west Peru unfortunately overrun by bachelors
across.explanation: BREWPUB(i.e. “place to drink”, or a pub that serves its own wacky brews). Solution is an anagram (indicated by “unfortunately”) of W (a recognised abbreviation of “west”) and PERU all placed in or “overrun by” BB (i.e. “bachelors” – B being a recognised abbreviation thereof), like so: B(REWPU)B.

across.text: Runs after insect close to some other creatures
across.explanation: ANTELOPES(i.e. “creatures”). Solution is LOPES (i.e. “runs”) placed “after” ANT (i.e. “insect”) and E (i.e. “close to some”, i.e. the last letter of “some”), like so: (ANT-E)-LOPES. We had ANTELOPE only last month in grid 1608, also on odd intersecting letters, so…

across.text: Grasp a bit of wood
across.explanation: TWIG. Solution satisfies “grasp” or understand, and “a bit of wood”.

across.text: Winner angry about sixth in javelin getting a medal
across.explanation: VICTORIA CROSS(i.e. “medal”). Solution is VICTOR (i.e. “winner”) and CROSS (i.e. “angry”) all wrapped “about” I (i.e. “sixth [letter] in javelin”) and A, like so: VICTOR-(I-A)-CROSS.

across.text: Canonises extraordinary biblical event
across.explanation: ASCENSION(i.e. “biblical event”). “Extraordinary” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of CANONISES. Nicely worked.

across.text: Stop working with Conservative friend, suppressing one little article
across.explanation: CALL IT A DAY(i.e. “stop working”). Solution is C (a recognised abbreviation of “Conservative”) followed by ALLY (i.e. “friend”) once wrapped around or “suppressing” I (i.e. “[Roman numeral] one”), TAD (i.e. a “little”) and A (i.e. “article”, being a word like a, an or the), like so: C-ALL(I-TAD-A)Y.

across.text: High society venerating Venus at times
across.explanation: EVENING STAR(i.e. “Venus at times” – can also be Mercury, apparently). Solution is an anagram (indicated by “high”) of S (a recognised abbreviation of “society”) and VENERATING.

across.text: Is angry girl finally ejected from rides?
across.explanation: FUMES(i.e. “is angry”). Solution is FLUMES (i.e. “rides” in amusement parks) with the L (i.e. “girl finally”, i.e. the last letter of “girl”) removed or “ejected”.

across.text: Swooped to arrest Harry’s pal, it’s said
across.explanation: PRONOUNCED(i.e. “said”). Solution is POUNCED (i.e. “swooped “) wrapped around or “arresting” RON Weasley (i.e. “Harry [Potter]’s pal”), like so: P(RON)OUNCED.

across.text: Certify a temperature check
across.explanation: ATTEST(i.e. “certify”). Solution is A followed by T (a recognised abbreviation of “temperature”) and TEST (i.e. “check”).

across.text: One receiving item of clothing found in a river
across.explanation: ADDRESSEE(i.e. “one receiving item”). Solution is DRESS (i.e. “item of clothing”) placed “in” A and DEE (i.e. Scottish “river”), like so: A-D(DRESS)EE.

across.text: Vicar finished – prepare to move?
across.explanation: REV UP(i.e. “prepare to move” motor vehicle). Solution is REV (i.e. “vicar”, short for reverend) followed by UP (i.e. “finished”).

across.text: Switch positions to get beer regularly discounted
across.explanation: ON OFFER(i.e. “discounted”). Solution is ON OFF (i.e. electrical “switch positions”) followed by ER (i.e. “beer regularly”, i.e. every other letter of BEER).

across.text: Visionary bank employee is after loads of money
across.explanation: FORTUNE-TELLER(i.e. “visionary”). Solution is TELLER (i.e. “bank employee”) placed “after” FORTUNE (i.e. “loads of money”). FORTUNE-TELLING appeared back in January in grid 1597, but on even intersecting letters.

across.text: Conservative position on playing fields?
across.explanation: RIGHT-WING. Solution satisfies “Conservative” and “position on playing fields”.

across.text: Look – African country’s backed abandoning island test site
across.explanation: LOS ALAMOS(i.e. atomic bomb “test site” in New Mexico). Solution is LO (i.e. “look”, as in lo and behold) followed by SOMALIA’S (i.e. “African country’s”) once the I has been removed (indicated by “abandoning island” – I being a recognised abbreviation of “island”), like so: LO-S’ALAMOS.

across.text: Criminal fetches pie, I go for some coins
across.explanation: PIECES OF EIGHT(i.e. “some coins”). “Criminal” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of FETCHES PIE I GO.

across.text: Old Arab wins a race, newcomer admits
across.explanation: SARACEN(i.e. “old Arab”). “Admits” indicates the solution has been hidden in the clue, like so: WIN(S A RACE N)EWCOMER.

across.text: Range of addresses covering area
across.explanation: URALS(i.e. mountain “range”). Solution is URLS (i.e. web “addresses”, short for Uniform Resource Locators) wrapped around or “covering” A (a recognised abbreviation of “area”), like so: UR(A)LS.

across.text: Turner finished study at last in solitary setting?
across.explanation: LONDON EYE(i.e. a famous big wheel or “turner”). Solution is DONE (i.e. “finished”) and Y (i.e. “study at last”, i.e. the last letter of “study”) all placed “in” LONE (i.e. “solitary”), like so: LON(DONE-Y)E.

across.text: Something unique I do away with
across.explanation: ONE-OFF(i.e. “something unique”). Solution is ONE (i.e. “I”) followed by OFF (i.e. kill or “do away with”).

across.text: Unconventional sort of complimentary booze
across.explanation: FREE SPIRIT(i.e. “unconventional”). Solution is FREE (i.e. “complimentary”) followed by SPIRIT (i.e. “booze”).

across.text: For example, A&E records
across.explanation: NOTES. Solution satisfies “for example, A&E” – both musical notes – and “records”.

across.text: Race brother frantically to become leader
across.explanation: TORCHBEARER(i.e. “leader”). “Frantically” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of RACE BROTHER.

across.text: Hamming it up and going too far not concerning
across.explanation: OVERACTING(i.e. “hamming it up”). Solution is OVERREACTING (i.e. “going too far”) with the RE removed (indicated by “not concerning” or regarding – think email replies).

across.text: Poet briefly following an elected official, at first quite slowly
across.explanation: ANDANTINO(i.e. “quite slowly” in musical lingo). Solution is DANTE Alighieri (i.e. “poet”) with its last letter removed (indicated by “briefly”) and the remainder placed after or “following” AN. This is all then followed by IN (i.e. “elected”) and O (i.e. “official, at first”, or the first letter of “official”), like so: AN-(DANT)-IN-O.

across.text: Place for child beginning to be mature has food and game equipment
across.explanation: CRIBBAGE BOARD(i.e. “game equipment”). Solution is CRIB (i.e. “place for child”) followed by B (i.e. “beginning to be”, i.e. the first letter of “be”), then AGE (i.e. “mature”) and BOARD (i.e. “food”, as in room and board).

across.text: Fruit chopped near a city
across.explanation: LIMA(i.e. capital “city” of Peru). Solution is LIME (i.e. “fruit”) with the last letter removed (indicated by “chopped”) and the remainder followed by A, like so: LIM-A.

across.text: Dossier contains lady with a grand bird of prey
across.explanation: FISH EAGLE(i.e. “bird of prey”). Solution is FILE (i.e. “dossier”) wrapped around or “containing” SHE (i.e. “lady”), A and G (a recognised abbreviation of “grand”), like so: FI(SHE-A-G)LE.

across.text: Queen put on a lot of perfume approaching unknown landscape
across.explanation: SCENERY(i.e. “landscape”). Solution is ER (i.e. “queen”, specifically Elizabeth Regina) placed “on” or after SCENT (i.e. “perfume”) once its last letter has been removed (indicated by “a lot of…”). This is all then followed by Y (i.e. “unknown” – setters love referring to X, Y or Z in solutions as unknowns), like so: SCEN-(ER)-Y.

down.text: Reportedly drink a bunch
down.explanation: BEVY(i.e. “a bunch”). “Reportedly” indicates homophone. Solution is a homophone of BEVVY (i.e. slang for a “drink”, short for beverage). That said, BEVY is an acceptable spelling, so the homophone wasn’t particularly needed.

down.text: Old flame – extremely critical pointed and shouted
down.explanation: EXCLAIMED(i.e. “shouted”). Solution is EX (i.e. “old flame”) followed by CL (i.e. “extremely critical”, i.e. the first and last letters of “critical”) and AIMED (i.e. “pointed”).

down.text: Country’s crazy public school fee in paper
down.explanation: PEOPLE’S REPUBLIC OF CHINA(i.e. “country”). “Crazy” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of PUBLIC SCHOOL FEE IN PAPER.

down.text: Description of a city is hyped
down.explanation: BUILT-UP. Solution satisfies “description of a city” and “hyped”.

down.text: Choices read out for church district
down.explanation: ARCHDIOCESE(i.e. “church district”). “Out” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of CHOICES READ.

down.text: Fellow reportedly in favour of boxing with piece of wood
down.explanation: TWO-BY-FOUR(i.e. “piece of wood”). Solution is TOBY (i.e. “fellow’s” name) followed by a homophone (indicated by “reportedly”, again) of FOR (i.e. “in favour of”) wrapped around or “boxing” W (a recognised abbreviation of “with”), like so: T(W)OBY-FOUR.

down.text: Man perhaps following large thread
down.explanation: LISLE(i.e. a type of “thread”). Solution is ISLE (i.e. “Man perhaps”, other isles are available) placed after or “following” L (a recognised abbreviation of “large”), like so: L-ISLE.

down.text: Song perhaps heard by footballer who’s trying to stop a fight
down.explanation: PEACEKEEPER(i.e. “who’s trying to stop a fight”). Solution is a homophone (indicated by “heard”) of PIECE (i.e. “song”) followed by KEEPER (i.e. “footballer”), like so: PEACE-KEEPER. Also appeared in grid 1570 back in August, also on odd intersecting letters, so…

down.text: What might be pulled by worker without a complaint?
down.explanation: SICKIE. One of those “& lit” clues where the solution satisfies the clue in general. The clue plays on “complaint” being an illness, rather than a grievance.

down.text: Stretch outside street, making a high-pitched noise
down.explanation: WHISTLE(i.e. “high-pitched noise”). Solution is WHILE (i.e. “stretch” or length of time) wrapped around or placed “outside” of ST (a recognised abbreviation of “street”), like so: WHI(ST)LE.

down.text: Military officer at peak time cuts power source
down.explanation: GENERATOR(i.e. “power source”). Solution is GEN (i.e. “military officer”, short for a General) and TOR (i.e. “peak”) wrapped around or “cut” by ERA (i.e. another length of “time”), like so: GEN-(ERA)-TOR.

down.text: He thinks of battleground prepared for old warriors
down.explanation: KNIGHTS OF THE ROUND TABLE(i.e. “old warriors”). “Prepared” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of HE THINKS OF BATTLEGROUND.

down.text: Scared of loud tirade
down.explanation: FEARFUL(i.e. “scared”). Solution is F (i.e. “loud”, specifically a recognised abbreviation of “forte” in musical lingo) followed by EARFUL (i.e. “tirade”).

down.text: Vehicle heading north uncovered barren region of Spain
down.explanation: NAVARRE(i.e. “region of Spain”). Solution is VAN (i.e. “vehicle”) reversed (indicated by “heading north” – this being a down clue) and followed by ARRE (i.e. “uncovered barren”, i.e. the word “barren” with its first and last letters removed), like so: NAV-ARRE.

down.text: Cow with no hair scratching head underneath pine
down.explanation: LONGHORN(i.e. “cow”). Solution is SHORN (i.e. “with no hair”) with its first letter removed (indicated by “scratching head”) and the remainder placed after or “underneath” – this being a down clue – LONG (i.e. to yearn or “pine” for), like so: LONG-HORN.

down.text: Irate with sons joining forces
down.explanation: STEAMING(i.e. “irate”). Solution is S (a recognised abbreviation of “sons”) followed by TEAMING (i.e. “joining forces”).

down.text: Chuck’s brief liaison
down.explanation: FLING. Solution satisfies to “chuck” and “brief liaison”.

down.text: Part of staircase in skyscraper is erected
down.explanation: RISER(i.e. “part of staircase”). “In” indicates the solution has been hidden in the clue, like so: SKYSCRAPE(R IS ER)ECTED.

down.text: US city home for French mathematician
down.explanation: Pierre SimonLAPLACE(i.e. “French mathematician”). Solution is LA (i.e. “US city”, Los Angeles) followed by PLACE (i.e. “home”).

down.text: Estimate includes time left to make chicken
down.explanation: GUTLESS(i.e. “chicken”). Solution is GUESS (i.e. “estimate”) wrapped around or “including” T (a recognised abbreviation of “time”) and L (ditto “left”), like so: GU(T-L)ESS.

down.text: Certain figures having uncool origins
down.explanation: SQUARE ROOTS(i.e. “figures”). Solution is SQUARE (i.e. “uncool”) followed by ROOTS (i.e. “origins”).

down.text: Learn beagle is changing – it’s not as big as it could be!
down.explanation: ENLARGEABLE(i.e. “it’s not as big as it could be”). “Is changing” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of LEARN BEAGLE.

down.text: Minor accident producing deficit
down.explanation: SHORTFALL(i.e. “deficit”). When written as SHORT FALL the solution also satisfies “minor accident”.

down.text: Take a drink, perfecting way of removing liquid
down.explanation: SIPHONING(i.e. “way of removing liquid”). Solution is SIP (i.e. “take a drink”) followed by HONING (i.e. “perfecting”).

down.text: Lessen the impact of a university from the south interrupting a degree (English)
down.explanation: EXTENUATE(i.e. “lessen the impact of”). Solution is A and U (a recognised abbreviation of “university”) reversed (indicated by “from the south” – this being a down clue) and placed in or “interrupting” EXTENT (i.e. “a degree” of). This is all then followed by E (a recognised abbreviation of “English”), like so: EXTEN(U-A)T-E.

down.text: Title of organ recital ultimately upset music fan
down.explanation: EARLDOM(i.e. “title”). Solution is EAR (i.e. “organ”) followed by L (i.e. “recital ultimately”, i.e. the last letter of “recital”) and MOD (i.e. “music fan”) once this latter has been reversed (indicated by “upset” – this being a down clue), like so: EAR-L-DOM.

down.text: Drink last of liquor, slump over, and cry due to this?
down.explanation: TEAR GAS(i.e. “cry due to this”). Solution is TEA (i.e. a “drink”) followed by R (i.e. “last [letter] of liquor”) and SAG (i.e. “slump”) once this latter has been reversed (indicated by “over”), like so: TEA-R-GAS.

down.text: Sculpture is a consolation
down.explanation: RELIEF. Solution satisfies “sculpture” and “consolation”.

down.text: Look around park and castle on vacation
down.explanation: RECCE(i.e. “look around”, military slang for reconnaissance). Solution is REC (i.e. “park”, short for recreation) followed by CE (i.e. “castle on vacation”, i.e. the word “castle” with all its middle letters removed).

down.text: Toy losing head in whirlpool
down.explanation: EDDY(i.e. “whirlpool”). Solution is TEDDY (i.e. “toy”, a teddy bear) with its first letter removed (indicated by “losing head”).
